content.description: Sit start the steep cylinder. Move up the arête and across the visor to a scary top out. This has a bad landing... make sure you have adequate pads, spotters, and ability.
content.location: It ascends the far left arête.

content.description: stand start (with a pad stack if needed) the right arête. Take a large rounded jug rail for your right hand and a barely there sloper on the Arete for the left…. Punch to the crimps in the crack and surf the jug crack a couple moves left to top out straight up…. …. The true sit is a hard project still.
content.location: It ascends the steep right arête.

content.description: This is a comp-style dyno in the middle of the cave. Start with both of your hands in the seam in the angle change, and jump to the small jug at the lip. The topout is easy.Please don't use the micro flakes in the face. They are loose and crumbly (they're also not useful).Also, please let me know if someone has done this before!
content.protection: The landing is bad. Use 3 pads at a minimum. 6 with a couple of spotters would be safer.
content.location: It climbs the main face of the Silence Boulder between The Sound of Silence and Silent Disbelief.

content.description: Silence Boulder is a big, steep block with potential.
